usecase.schedule

Interface Schedule<E extends IEvent>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - a subclass of IEvent
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Scheduler

    public interface Schedule<E extends IEvent>
extends java.io.Serializable
    A Schedule manages a collection of IEvent, ensures no conflicting IEvent based on the time period and location they occupy and it's occupancy level.

    Two IEvents are overlapping if they occupy an overlapping time period.

    Class Invariant:
    For every pair IEvents A, B in the Schedule, if they overlaps, then:

    • A and B don't have OCCUPANCY_ABSOLUTE.
    • If A have OCCUPANCY_SPECIFIC, then A and B occupy a different location.
    • If A have OCCUPANCY_NO, then B can occupy any location.
    Some other Class Invariant:
    • if getConflicting(e).length == 0 then add(e) won't throws an exception.

    This class provides underlying logic for EventManage and TaskManage to ensures no double booking of event or task!

    See Also:
    OccupancyLevel

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(E e)
        Add an IEvent to this Schedule, and ensures no conflicting events that breaks the class invariant. If an IEvent failed to add, it shouldn't be added.

        If the IEvent failed to add it throws an ScheduleException contains the list of conflicting events.

        Parameters:
        e - the IEvent to add.
        Throws:
        ScheduleException - if the IEvent can't be added.

      • remove

        void remove(E e)
        Remove an IEvent from this Schedule. If such IEvent not exist, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        e - the IEvent to remove.

      • removeIf

        void removeIf(java.util.function.Predicate<E> predicate)
        Remove IEvent from this Schedule. If the predicate is true.
        Parameters:
        predicate - remove if the predicate is true.

      • has

        boolean has(E e)
        Check the IEvent belongs to this Schedule.
        Parameters:
        e - the IEvent to check.
        Returns:
        true iff the event belongs here, false otherwise.

      • getAll

        java.util.List<E> getAll()
        Get all the IEvent stored inside this Schedule.
        Returns:
        all the IEvent stored inside this Schedule as a List.

      • getConflicting

        java.util.List<E> getConflicting(E e)
        Get an list of IEvent, that is conflicting with the IEvent provided. The example use of this method is to assist organizer to plan out events. To check the conflicting events, you should first check it's occupancy level: - if the new event has OCCUPANCY_ABSOLUTE, then iterate through all events to find any events that has overlapping time to the new event. Those events are conflicting with the new event, because OCCUPANCY_ABSOLUTE don't allow anything else with an overlapping time. - if the new event has OCCUPANCY_SPECIFIC, then iterate through all events to find any events that has overlapping time and has same location to the new event, Those events are conflicting with the new event, because OCCUPANCY_SPECIFIC don't allow anything else that has an overlapping time and at the same location. - if the new event has OCCUPANCY_NO, then there are no conflicting events, because OCCUPANCY_NO allows anything else at the same or different location and time.
        Parameters:
        e - the IEvent to check.
        Returns:
        a list of IEvent.
